attributes.description: This Sourcemap will track the materials and byproducts that go into the building of a Capita snowboard at the Elan Snowboard Factory in Austria. Where the materials are obtained and how many hands they pass through is the main focal point of this project.
attributes.title: Capita Snowboards Sourcemap

attributes.description: Due to the limited number of bulk Triax and Biax fiberglass suppliers worldwide, a series of deductions were made in the proposition that the Alibaba Group is the supplier to the Elan factory for the construction of Capita snowboards. Elan would in no doubt be using large amounts of fiberglass in the construction of Capita, among other brands boards. Alibaba would provide the cost effective labour needed in order to supply Elan with mass quantities (Capita Snowboards 2013b; Alibaba Group 2013).
attributes.address: 699号 Wangshang Road, Binjiang, Hangzhou, Zhejiang, China, 310052
attributes.title: Alibaba Group Fiberglass

attributes.description: Certain high-end Capita snowboards use a material called "Basalt", which is made from volcanic rock. It has similar properties to carbon fiber in terms of rigidity, but will outlast carbon in overall durability. This is an educated guess as to the supplier of Elan's basalt material, as there is limited information on their, or Capita's websites (Capita 2013b; Vulkan Europe 2013).
attributes.title: VULKAN Basalt Fiber Products
Elan Snowboard Factory
attributes.description: This is the factor where Capita snowboards are built. A multitude of materials are outsourced from other vendors and are then assembled here to create the final product. Elan acts as the central hub of production. While Capita is not the only brand the factory produces, it is certainly one of their more successful. The factory acts similar to a sandwich shop, in that many of their materials are outsourced to other suppliers and Capita simply picks which ones they want in their boards. After a board is completed it is then shipped off to the distributor, in this case being No Limits Distribution out of Vancouver, BC (Elan Snowboards 2013a).

attributes.title: SI-CORE
attributes.description: SI-CORE supplies Elan with their wood cores for snowboard manufacturing. According to the Capita and Elan websites, their core vendor (which is left ambiguos) uses "Reforestation Certified Sustainable Wood Cores"; which means, SI-CORE grows trees specifically to be used in snowboard core manufacturing. The theory behind this is that by having them grow and harvest their own trees SI-CORE has less of an environmental impact.  (Capita 2013a; Elan Snowboard 2013b; SI-CORE 2013)

attributes.title: No Limits Distribution
attributes.address: 2-98 West 5th Avenue, Vancouver, BC V5Y 1H7, Canada
attributes.description: No Limits Distribution purchases the fully assembled Capita snowboards from the Elan factory and stores them in their warehouse located in Vancouver. They in turn will then sell the boards to local shops, which will then be sold to the public (No Limits 2013).

attributes.title: BMB Ski & Board
attributes.address: Industrieweg 2A, Stormpolder, 2921 LB Krimpen aan den IJssel, The Netherlands
attributes.description: BMB Ski & Board provides the Elan factory with the steel edge material used to construct the outer edge of a snowboard. The steel comes in large rolls and is pressed into the necessary shape at BMB before it is shipped to Elan. At Elan it is then cut to the desired shape/length and pressed into each snowboard individually (BMB Ski & Board 2013).

attributes.title: C3 Worldwide
attributes.address: 2700 West Commodore Way #301, Seattle, WA 98199, USA
attributes.description: C3 Worldwide is the head office of Capita Snowboards. All boards are designed here before being sent off to the Elan factory for construction (C3 Worldwide 2013).

attributes.title: SABIC Plastics
attributes.description: For Elan to get their snowboard base material, which is made from Ultra-High-Molecular-Weight-Polyethylene  (UHMWPE), they would turn to a company like SABIC Plastics to fulfill their needs. This is only an educated assumption as there is little found on European UHMWPE manufacturers. It would be safe to deduce that Elan would need a source close to the factory to keep shipping/overall costs down (SABIC Plastics 2013a; 2013b).

attributes.title: Entropy Resins
attributes.address: Carrer Rosalia de Castro, 21, 08025 Barcelona, Spain
attributes.description: There is little information available on snowboard resin /glue suppliers. This could be do to potential negative environmental impacts and keeping companies in good standing. This is only an educated assumption. It would be safe to assume that they would need a source close to the factory to keep shipping/overall costs down; same as SABIC Plastics. Resins and glues are used to keep materials attached to the snowboards wood core during final manufacture (Entropy Resins 2013).

attributes.title: Showcase Snowboard Shop
attributes.description: Showcase would purchase a Capita board from No Limits Distribution and then, in turn, sell it on their sales floor to the consumer (Showcase 2013).

attributes.title: ISO Sport Plastics
attributes.description: ISO Sport plastics is one of the only plastics manufacturers that publicly advertises on their website that they provide snowboard manufacturers with the constructed sidewall material Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS). While ISO Sport does not state if they provide Elan with their sidewalls, their proximity to the factory and their specialization would suggest a likely link (ISO Sport Plastics 2013; Go Polymers 2013).

attributes.title: SI-CORE to Elan Snowboard Factory
attributes.description:
SI-CORE provides the wood "core" components of a snowboard to the Elan Snowboard Factory. SI-CORE appears to specialize in Ski and Snowboard wood core manufacturing.

According to the Capita and Elan websites their wood cores come from "Reforestation Certified Sustainable" forests; meaning that SI-CORE is growing their own trees specifically to be harvested for making these cores. The theory behind this is to minimize negative environmental impact.

http://www.capitasnowboarding.com/tech/core

http://www.elansnowboards.com/en/plab/eco-woodcore

attributes.title: Elan Snowboard Factory to No Limits Distribution
BMB Ski & Board to Elan Snowboard Factory
attributes.description:
BMB is the factory in which Elan purchases their steel edge material for the edges of the snowboard. These come in large rolls that are then cut at Elan and shaped for the individual board. 


http://www.bmb-ski.nl/index.php?option=com_contact&view=contact&id=1&Itemid=58&lang=en
